moves.1. e4 c5: My favourite move to 1.e4 is now 1...c5.
moves.2... g6: I try to control a1-h8 diagonal.
moves.4... cxd4: I take it!    Maybe it was an inattention.
moves.5. Qf3: hahaha he tries to end the game at move 6.
moves.6. Bg5 Bg7 7. Bf4 e6 8. g4 d5: In Sicilian I often push d5.
moves.9. exd5 exd5 10. Bb5 Bxg4 11. Qg3 a6: a6 is not a mistake but I could move Qa5  and I take the Bishop.
moves.12. Be2 Qe7 13. f3 Bf5 14. Kd2: Move the uncastled king to protect a pawn when it can be protected with other moves, sounds like a mistake.....
moves.14... Be4: Be4! Maybe the ! is too much but it's a good trap.
moves.15. Nh3 Qd7: Well, it's a bad tactic......I mean: maybe white thinks if he takes the bishop, the queen would take the pawn and then the Q is very close to the K (even if there's no possibility to attack him in that way), so I moved the Q........I know it's a li'l crazy, but, you know, I'm not Tal's son.
moves.16. Ng5 Qe7: It didn't work...like I was afraid.
moves.17. Bd6 Qd7 18. Be5 Nh5: Nh5! to attack Q and Bishop and protect my B.
moves.19. Bxg7: B:g7??        Maybe it was an inattention.
moves.19... Nxg3 20. fxe4: f:e4?         Maybe it was an inattention.
moves.24. Kxe2 Qg4+: This time the inattention is mine. I would take the N  ing the K, but I didn't see B
moves.26. Kd3 Qxf6 27. Nxh7 Qf1+ 28. Ke4 Qf5#: Qf5#. My opponent is not new on this kind of mistakes [(except 19.B:g7) (see the first game against him)]. Maybe I would win without mistake on move 19......Anyway, thanks for reading and comment! Bye!
